member.name: T:Eco.Plugins.Networking.LoginQueue
member.summary: This class controls the order in which users will be connected to the server if there are no space for everybody. It allows to add a client to expiable queue via JoinQueue method. Once added, the user will have to try to reconnect in next 10 seconds in order to keep his place in queue Once there are space to join, NetworkServer will connect the first not expired user from queue and advance queue to next one.

member.name: M:Eco.Plugins.Networking.LoginQueue.CleanExpiredClients
member.summary: Removes all expired consecutive clients in the queue and advances the queue.

member.name: M:Eco.Plugins.Networking.LoginQueue.EnsureClientPositionAndExpirationTime(System.Net.IPEndPoint)
member.summary: Adds a client to queue or updates his time

member.name: M:Eco.Plugins.Networking.LoginQueue.AdvanceQueueIfPossible
member.summary: Removes the first client in queue. Used when client leaves the queue by one of two reasons: expiration or successful login.

member.name: M:Eco.Plugins.Networking.LoginQueue.JoinQueue(System.Net.IPEndPoint)
member.summary: Adds a client to the queue if necessary.
member.returns: Returns 1 if client can join immediately. Otherwise returns the position in the queue.

member.name: T:Eco.Plugins.Networking.NetworkJoinHandler`1
member.summary: Handles queue joining logic and priorities relevant.
member.typeparam: Can be any type for tests.

member.name: M:Eco.Plugins.Networking.NetworkJoinHandler`1.#ctor(System.Func{`0,System.Boolean},System.Func{`0,System.Boolean},System.Func{`0,System.Int32,System.Boolean},Eco.Plugins.Networking.PriorityLoginQueue)
member.summary: Initialize the join handler with given delegates so that it be used for skipping protocols.
member.param: An admin always skips everything so if a client is an admin even if server connections are complete it should join.
A reserved slot jumps connection queues but in case the server connections is complete it can't connect to server.
This binds with the server configuration to determine if the given client can join the server or not, gives final say on if the client can join.(usually connection counts check)
Priority login queue to be used.

member.name: M:Eco.Plugins.Networking.NetworkJoinHandler`1.TryOccupySlot(`0)
member.summary: Check if empty slot exists and occupy it.

member.name: M:Eco.Plugins.Networking.NetworkJoinHandler`1.TryBypassQueue(`0)
member.summary: Returns true if client enters with no queue. It's based on space for connection (any open slots) and users in login queue (even if there are space, new user should wait if there are somebody before him)

member.name: M:Eco.Plugins.Networking.NetworkJoinHandler`1.TryJoinWithQueue(`0,System.Net.IPEndPoint,System.Int32,Eco.Shared.Math.Vector2i@)
member.summary: Returns true if new client should use queue. It's based on space for connection (any open slots) and users in login queue (even if there are space, new user should wait if there are somebody before him) result is Vector2i(Position, Queuelength) and (-1,-1) if success.

member.name: T:Eco.Plugins.Networking.NetworkServer
member.summary:
A wrapper around IUdpServer, with threads to handle send/receive and serialization of messages. Network events can be send with SendEvent or via interface with INetworkEventHandler.SendEvent"/>. They added to queue and then processed in background with method. It supports following network events:
- when client connected it welcomed with message containing protocol version and other server related info;
- server sends this message to the client multiple times per second with network object updates (newly bounded objects, updates for bounded objects and list of unbound (deleted) objects).
and used to perform Remote Procedure Calls (either server-to-client or client-to-server). Most noticeable there is MVC traffic performed with "ViewRPC" calls.
special event which happens when client or server initiates disconnect and contains disconnection reason.
used together with other events (like , and ) and contains MVC views initial data. Other messages itself doesn't contains View data, but instead has references to views sent in this event. It prevents from issues when same view sent in different messages from multiple threads or referenced in temporary objects for later delivery. It also allows to apply optimizations when same network data sent to multiple objects, because different clients may have different set of already bounded views and using references instead of full view data allows us to use exactly same data for all of them.
See Networking.md for additional details.

member.name: M:Eco.Plugins.Networking.NetworkServer.SendBinaryArrays(Eco.Core.Controller.IMvcNetClient,Eco.Shared.Networking.NetworkEvent,Eco.Shared.Pools.Collections.PoolableListWrapper{System.Byte[]})
member.summary: Sends and to the client.

member.name: T:Eco.Plugins.Networking.PriorityLoginQueue
member.summary: It's similar to Login Queue which allows to have expiable connections, but it also allows to prioritize them. For each priority of client it will create it's own login queue and it won't let you join until all queues with higher priority are empty

member.returns: Returns 1 if client can join immediately. Otherwise returns the position in the queue.

member.summary: Each type will generate its own tree. It will allow to make faster search by type, such as IPrey.

member.name: M:Eco.Plugins.Networking.QuadTreeNetObjectCollection.GetNewRelevantObjects(Eco.Shared.Networking.INetObjectViewer,Eco.Shared.Networking.INetObjectContainer,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the objects that are relevant to us. Objects newly added to the world are found by looking at time stamp of recently added ones. Objects that are not new but have become relevant because of distance are returned via quadtree query, and only sought if 'full search' is checked, because its a little slower.

member.name: T:Eco.Plugins.Profiling.ProfilingPlugin
member.summary: Allows admins to run profiling tasks on the server to get diagnostic data.
member.remarks: Can be run from server UI and called from in-game via commands (/profiler). Depends on `dotnet-dump` and `dotnet-trace` tools and requires them to be installed and available on system's PATH.

member.name: P:Eco.Plugins.Profiling.ProfilingPlugin.ExecutableDirectory
member.summary: Retrieves the servers current install directory. Due to either a bug or core change in .NET 6 a unique lookup method is required on MacOS Catalina or newer otherwise the server will crash on startup trying to write to the install folder of .NET which is now read only

member.summary: Used to display tool installation instructions in case of a tool presence error.
member.remarks: If the profiling session was started from server UI, will display popup window; otherwise a simplistic message requesting logs to be checked will be sent to the calling user as a notification.

member.name: M:Eco.Plugins.Profiling.ProfilingPlugin.DisplayNotification(Eco.Gameplay.Systems.Chat.IChatClient,Eco.Shared.Localization.LocString,Eco.Shared.Localization.LocString,Eco.Shared.Services.NotificationStyle)
member.summary: Send a status notification for the given user. If no user given, assumes call from Server UI and will display popup window instead.
member.param: The client to be notified. null means Server UI.
If needed, a caption can be provided. Server UI will use it as actual popup window caption, in-game notification will use this as a prefix for the notification.
The category to be used for notification. Will be translated to MessageBoxIcon for use in popup window when called from Server UI.

summary.para: Represents all possible transaction types within the RCON protocol.
For a more complete breakdown of the individual packet types refer to the documentation found on the Wiki https://wiki.play.eco/en/RCON#Packet_Types

member.name: F:Eco.Plugins.Rcon.RconPacketType.ResponseValue
member.summary: SERVERDATA_RESPONSE_VALUE: This packet type is sent by the server after completing a command execution.

member.name: F:Eco.Plugins.Rcon.RconPacketType.ExecCommand
member.summary: SERVERDATA_EXECCOMMAND: This packet type is sent by the client to request a command be run. This packet should be followed up by a ResponseValue packet containing the results of the execution.

member.name: F:Eco.Plugins.Rcon.RconPacketType.AuthResponse
member.summary: SERVERDATA_AUTH_RESPONSE: This packet type is sent by the server after receiving a Auth request packet. The contents of this packet vary based on the results of the authentication request. An invalid authentication request will contain a packet id of -1.

member.name: F:Eco.Plugins.Rcon.RconPacketType.Auth
member.summary: SERVERDATA_AUTH: This packet type is sent by the client to request authorization to use the RCON server and execute commands. It is followed up by a AuthResponse packet containing the results of authentication.

member.name: T:Eco.Plugins.Rcon.RconPacket
member.summary: Represents an RCON packet used by the RCON server inside RconPlugin. Handles the encode/decode of outbound and inbound packets.

member.name: M:Eco.Plugins.Rcon.RconPacket.WriteToAsync(System.Net.Sockets.NetworkStream,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Writes the RCON packet instance to a NetworkStream for sending over the network

member.name: M:Eco.Plugins.Rcon.RconPacket.FromStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads the RCON packet from a NetworkStream instance and returns the instance.

summary.para: This plugin adds Remote Console (RCON) support to the Eco Server. It follows the Source RCON standard used by majority of the industry. The plugin exposes a TCP socket (Default on port 3002) for allowing remote administrative command execution and automated command handling for tasks, tools, and shutdown procedures.
A complete how-to for RCON and a complete protocol breakdown can be found on the Wiki here: https://wiki.play.eco/en/RCON
